techmeme.title: Bluesky says it will comply with age-verification laws in South Dakota and Wyoming because they strike the "right balance", after exiting Mississippi (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
ByteDance launches Seedream 4.0, an AI image model it claims can beat Google's viral "nano banana" model in prompt adherence, alignment, and aesthetics (Vincent Chow/South China Morning Post)
Stability AI launches Stable Audio 2.5, which the company claims is the first audio generation model designed for "enterprise-grade use cases" (Sean Michael Kerner/Venturebeat)
Reddit launches free tools for publishers within Reddit Pro to track article performance and get suggestions on which communities to share their stories in (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Replit raised $250M led by Prysm, nearly tripling its valuation to $3B; its annualized revenue grew from $2.8M to $150M in the past year and it has 40M users (Shirin Ghaffary/Bloomberg)
